Sentencas: A multi-criteria assessment of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC)-based polygeneration is presented.
Titulo: Optimal heat recovery using photovoltaic thermal and thermoelectric generator for solid oxide fuel cell-based polygeneration system: Techno-economic and environmental assessments

Sentencas: Taking a residential area in Malaysia as the case study, the polygeneration is integrated with the photovoltaic thermal and thermoelectric generator as the most applicable heat recovery devices to be combined with a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC).
Titulo: Optimal heat recovery using photovoltaic thermal and thermoelectric generator for solid oxide fuel cell-based polygeneration system: Techno-economic and environmental assessments

Sentencas: The proposed recovery system is compared with the basic heat recovery system, which only employs a heat exchanger and an absorption chiller.
Titulo: Optimal heat recovery using photovoltaic thermal and thermoelectric generator for solid oxide fuel cell-based polygeneration system: Techno-economic and environmental assessments

Sentencas: The simulation study is conducted for the systems investigating the improvement in terms of energy, economic and environmental criteria.
Titulo: Optimal heat recovery using photovoltaic thermal and thermoelectric generator for solid oxide fuel cell-based polygeneration system: Techno-economic and environmental assessments

Sentencas: From the results, it reveals that the proposed heat recovery system achieves an efficiency of 11.38% higher and the grid consumption of 12.85% lower than the basic recovery system when the system was applied for gridconnected with electric vehicle supply attached.
Titulo: Optimal heat recovery using photovoltaic thermal and thermoelectric generator for solid oxide fuel cell-based polygeneration system: Techno-economic and environmental assessments

Sentencas: Moreover, the proposed system can reduce the carbon emission by 31.60% and 30.32% as compared to polygeneration with the basic heat recovery system and the separated system, respectively.
Titulo: Optimal heat recovery using photovoltaic thermal and thermoelectric generator for solid oxide fuel cell-based polygeneration system: Techno-economic and environmental assessments
